intro: Eriocaulon cheemenianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
